overwatch.security

Class LoginCrypto

  • java.lang.Object
    • overwatch.security.LoginCrypto

  • public class LoginCrypto
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides easy-to-use passphrase cryptography functions. Passphrases should never be stored in a database. Instead a salted hash of the passphrase should be stored along with its salt, for later comparison by the same hashing scheme. This ensures that user passphrases are unreadable even if the database is broken into.
    Version:
    3
    Author:
    Lee Coakley
    See Also:
    HashSaltPair

    • Constructor Detail

      • LoginCrypto

        public LoginCrypto()

    • Method Detail

      • generateHashSaltPair

        public static HashSaltPair generateHashSaltPair(java.lang.String inputPass)
        Generates a salted hash for storage in the database. Later used to evaluate passphrase correctness. The input passphrase itself MUST NOT BE STORED ANYWHERE.
        Parameters:
        inputPass - Passphrase string from user input.
        Returns:
        Immutable hash/salt pair to store in database.

      • isPassValid

        public static boolean isPassValid(java.lang.String inputPass,
                  HashSaltPair storedPair)
        Given the stored values, check if a user-input passphrase produces the same result.
        Parameters:
        inputPass - Passphrase string from user input.
        storedPair - Hex-encoded passphrase hash and salt.
        Returns:
        True if matches, false otherwise.
